results.title: You've got mail
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Lauren Shuler and Nora Ephron
results.brief_description: This story brings romance and courtship (as well as Meg Ryan, Tom Hanks and director Nora Ephron for the third time) into the age of the World Wide Web via email and chat rooms. Joe and Kathleen have a lot in common, they live near each other, they are both in the publishing industry, he in supersized book department stores - Foxbooks, and she in a small independent one - Shop Around the Corner, they even buy coffee at the same place. They have not met in person as yet, but they have met one another in a chat room where they bare their thoughts about life, work and their significant others who are less than perfect. Pretty soon NY152 and Shop Girl want to meet in person, which leads to inevitable angst when two soul mates discover they are business rivals. Cast also includes Parker Posey and Greg Kinnear.

results.title: Yojimbo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: A fine film by Kurosawa, in which a wandering samurai exploits two gangs who are fighting for control of a village. Very much a tongue-in-cheek samurai film, with Toshiro Mifune quite superb as the warrior who teaches both warring factions a lesson. Reverred for its black humour and technical mastery, “Yojimbo”, like many of Kurosawa’s works, was later remade — by Sergio Leone, as “A fistful of dollars”. Also available on VHS [301894].

results.title: Yesterday, today and tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Concordia, Paris and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Sophia Loren and Marcello Mastroianni appear in three separate stories. In the first, Adelina (Loren) is a blackmarket slum marketeer who remains permanently pregnant in order to escape a jail sentence, much to the consternation of her exhausted husband (Mastroianni). In the second, Anna, the elegant wife of a rich Milan industrialist, meets her lover for a secret rendezvous. In the third, Mara is a call girl having an affair with a Bologna playboy. Saucy entertainment from two of the best actors to come out of Italy, this film confirmed Loren’s and Mastroianni’s success as international sex symbols. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Yes, Giorgio
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation, Peter Fetterman and Franklin J. Schaffner
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy about an opera singer who loses his voice, the beautiful doctor who helps him find it, and the love affair which results. Includes an extensive segment from the opera, Turandot. Stars Luciano Pavarotti as Giorgio, Kathryn Harrold and Eddie Albert. Original music composed and conducted by Michael J. Lewis. Contains some scenes in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Yentl
results.creator_credit: Ladbroke Entertainment, United Artists Corporation, Barwood Films, Barbra Streisand and Rusty Lemorande
results.brief_description: Based on the short story “Yentl, the Yeshiva boy” by Isaac Bashevis Singer, this is the poignant tale of a young European Jewish woman (Barbara Streisand), circa 1904, who disguises herself as a boy in order to pursue her passion for studying holy scripture, an endeavour restricted exclusively to men in orthodox Jewish culture. As the education of women is prohibited in her society, she must keep her identity a secret. The strangely deceptive world this creates poses many challenges for this intrepid character who, in overcoming them, proves that nothing is impossible. The making of this modern classic was a milestone, not only for its main creative force, the legendary Streisand, but for motion picture history. “Yentl” marked the first time that a woman had produced, co-written, directed and starred in a major feature film.

results.title: Yellow Submarine
results.creator_credit: King Features Entertainment, Subafilms, Apple Films, TV Cartoons, Al Brodax and George Dunning
results.brief_description: This animated feature has the Beatles on an odyssey to Pepperland, ‘18000 leagues beneath the sea’, to take on the music-hating Blue Meanies. Pepperland was a paradise until the “Meanies” moved in and everyone had given up hope. Until the Beatles arrived in their yellow submarine to save the day. It is a fascinating but uneven anthology of contemporary art and graphic design up to the late sixties - surrealism, art nouveau, op and pop art - brought together by designer Edelman’s flattened comic strip, Lennon style whimsy out of Lear and Carroll and play upon the Beatles’ myth. Stand-out sequences include ‘Sergeant Pepperland’, the Borowczyk-style Liverpool sequence, ‘Eleanor Rigby’ with Charles Jenkins’ special effects, ‘Nowhere Man’ and Dunning’s rotoscoped ‘Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds’. Voices: John Clive, Geoffrey Hughes, Peter Batten, Paul Angelis, Dick Emery, Lance Percival.

results.title: Yankee doodle dandy
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, William Cagney and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: George B. Cohan, born on the 4th of July, became one of Broadway’s legendary composers. Cohan’s prolific career spanned 55 years where he wrote 35 plays and 500 songs including “Harrigan”, “Give my regards to Broadway”, and of course “Yankee Doodle Dandy.” This is an exuberant song and dance production starring James Cagney, with his typical flair, in the title role. This film premiered in 1942 and was a salute to American patriotism and the ‘Grand old flag’, yet time has not dulled its freshness and energy.

results.title: XXX
results.creator_credit: Revolution Studios, Neil H Neil H. Moritz and Rob Cohen
results.brief_description: Director Rob Cohen’s second outing with action star Vin Diesel (their first collaboration was the very successful The Fast and the furious) is a playful hybrid of the James Bond spy movies and extreme sports action. Diesel stars as adrenaline junky Xander Cage who is coerced by the US government into infiltrating a Russian crime ring based in the Czech republic that is planning, amongst other things, the destruction of the world. XXX makes no secret of its Bond appropriations. Cohen gleefully includes in the mix an evil genius based in an elaborate (and not very conspicuous) mountain lair, a beautiful but dangerous woman (Asia Argento), Russian bad guys (yes they’re still bad, irregardless of the Cold War being over), state of the art gizmos and plenty of explosions. It even alludes to the beginnings of a long standing franchise. Cast includes: Samuel L. Jackson, Marton Csokas.

results.title: Wuthering Heights (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Samuel Goldwyn and William Wyler
results.brief_description: A passionate interpretation of Emily Bronte’s classic Victorian novel starring Laurence Olivier, Merle Oberon, David Niven, Donald Crisp, Flora Robson and Geraldine Fitzgerald.
